bioghist.p: One United Michigan is a 501(c)(4) public charity of Republican, Democrat, business, labor, social and religious organizations coming together to defend affirmative action and outreach programs that provide opportunities for women and minorities for better jobs and education and reject all efforts that would adversely affect or reverse equal opportunity programs designed to overcome discrimination in the state of Michigan. Headquartered in Lansing, One United Michigan existed from 2005-2006. One United Michigan planned, organized, and recruited volunteers and allies for, and led a statewide campaign to preserve affirmative action and diversity. It was most known for its statewide campaign against Proposal 2 to amend the Michigan Constitution to ban affirmative action programs that give preferential treatment to groups or individuals for public employment, education, or contracting purposes. In November 2006, voters approved Proposal 2, the third state to ban affirmative action programs.

scopecontent.p: The One United Michigan records (0.25 linear feet and one oversize folder) consist of materials related to a statewide campaign to preserve affirmative action and diversity programs and the fight against Proposal 2, which banned these programs. Records include press kits, conference materials, published material against Proposal 2, the digital capture of One United Michigan’s web site, signs, and audio-visual materials including informational DVDs of interviews with people about the importance of maintaining affirmative actions programs. The records are arranged into six series: Conference Material, Press Kits, Published Materials, Website, Audio-Visual Materials, and oversized Signs.
Conference Material (1 folder) contains a packet of information from the Michigan Women's Summit in 2006.

The Press Kits (2 folders) contains two kits of information directed at the media regarding affirmative action and diversity in Michigan. Kits include talking points, training plans, ballot language, brief history and fact sheets on affirmative action, FAQs, and a PowerPoint presentation.

did.unittitle: Passing the Torch: Preserving the Flame

scopecontent.p: Published Materials (4 folders) contain articles about Proposal 2, brochures, flyers and pamphlets about Proposal 2, and two reports written in favor of affirmative action and diversity in Michigan.

did.unittitle: "Potential Impact of the Michigan Civil Rights Initiative on Employment, Education and Contracting"

scopecontent.p: The Website series (303 digital files, 103 MB) was captured from a direct transfer from the One United Michigan website located at http://www.oneunitedmichigan.org/. [Note that some functionality has been lost in the attempt to preserve the website.] The website is divided into sections: Join the Campaign, About Us, Get Involved, Press Room, Resources and Donate. The captured website contains PDF files, newsletters, InfoKits, resolutions and media clips.

did.unittitle: Website capture and printout on December 15, 2006

scopecontent.p: The Digital Video Discs series consist six DVDs that include conference presentations and short press clips of interviews with women and minority figures in Michigan.

did.unittitle: Michigan Women's Summit 2005 Challenges to Equity

scopecontent.p: The Signs series contains three oversize items: one hand sign, one yard sign, and one poster against Proposal 2.
